skills.name: Benefits of Iconography
skills.description: Improving understanding, navigation, and visual appeal with icons.

skill_levels.skill_level_description: Cannot explain benefits of using effective icons.
Limited explanation of benefits of icons like they help with space saving.
Explains how icons enhance user understanding and navigation improvement.
Explains how icons enahnce visual appeal and user experience
Analyzes impact of icon selection & style on user perception and information hierarchy.

skills.name: Creating Effective Icons
skills.description: Selecting clear and appropriate icons.

skill_levels.skill_level_description: does not use icons.
Selects icons based on personal preference without considering design principles.
Chooses somewhat recognizable icons but lacks consistency.
Selectes or creates consistent and clear icons aligned with design.
Effectively selects or creates clear, concise & culturally appropriate icons from icon libraries

skills.name: Importance of Branding
skills.description: Understanding the role and benefits of strong brand identity.

skill_levels.skill_level_description: Cannot explain benefits of a strong brand identity.
Limited explanation of brand recognition.
Explains how branding creates consistent & memorable user experience across multiple touchpoints.
Explains how a strong brand fosters loyalty, emotional connection, and advocacy.
Analyzes impact of branding on perception and differentiation.

skills.name: Creation of Brands
skills.description: Developing visuals that reflect brand identity and values.

skill_levels.skill_level_description: Cannot make design decisions.
Ignores brand alignment while making design decisions.
Creates basic branding but struggles with translating brand values into design elements.
Consistently represents brand identity in visuals.
Holistic branding approach, all decisions reflect brand's core values

skills.name: Understanding Color Theory
skills.description: Benefits of color theory in design.

skill_levels.skill_level_description: Cannot explain benefits of color theory.
Limited explanation only e.g. color theory helps create visually appealing designs
Explains that color theory can be used to create a cohesive color palette
Explains how color theory can be used to evoke emotions, influence user behaviour & imporve brand recognition
Analyzes color combinations' impact on user perception accessibility & cultural context

skills.name: Applying Color Theory
skills.description: Creating visually harmonious and emotionally resonant palettes.

skill_levels.skill_level_description: Palette has no connection to design principles or color theory
Colour palette only achieves basic visual harmony, avoids clashes.
Uses established color theory principles like analogus schemes, compementary colours etc.
Develops harmonious palettes aligned with design goals.
Strategically chosen palettes that are aesthetically pleasing, enhance emotion & user experience.

skills.name: Understanding Figma
skills.description: Purpose and advantages of using Figma.

skill_levels.skill_level_description: Cannot explain Figma's purpose.
Thinks Figma can be used only for simple design tasks.
Explains Figma is used to create mockups and interfaces.
Explains Figma improves efficiency and collaboration benefits.
Analyzes Figma vs. other design tools and can list pros and cons

skills.name: Using Figma for Design
skills.description: Using Figma's features for professional design.

skill_levels.skill_level_description: Cannot use Figma.
Knows how to create only basic designs with limited functionality.
Can create layouts and mockups but struggles with complexity.

skills.name: Understanding Prototyping
skills.description: Benefits of basic prototyping in Figma.

skill_levels.skill_level_description: Cannot explain the benefits of basic prototyping.
Explains basic prototypes help visualize user flows but lacks depth.

Explains how to create simple prototypes with basic interactions and navigation.

skill_levels.skill_level_description: Cannot create prototypes.
Can only link screens without transitions.
Creates prototypes with some interactions but lacks clarity.

skills.name: Understanding Functional Micro-Interactions

skill_levels.skill_level_description: Cannot explain impact micro-interactions have on design

Explains how to create clear & concise micro-interactions

skills.name: Designing Functional Micro-Interactions

skill_levels.skill_level_description: Cannot design micro-interactions.

skills.name: Importance of Responsive Interactions
skills.description: Designing responsive micro-interactions.

skill_levels.skill_level_description: Cannot explain importance of responsiveness.
Explains responsive micro-interaction make interfaces more engaging (limited explaination)

Explains that micro-interactions are responsive to different user interactions (touch vs click) & device contexts (mobile vs desktop).

skills.name: Designing Responsive Interactions
skills.description: Responsive micro-interactions adapting to various contexts.

skill_levels.skill_level_description: Cannot design micro-interactions.
Attempts to create responsive micro-interactions but struggles with adapting to interactions or devices.

skills.name: Identifying Touch Points

skill_levels.skill_level_description: Cannot identify user touch points.
Can only identify basic touch points for a product or service.
Identifies edge cases but may lack a systematic approach, missing offline points.

Develops strategies to optimize the user experience across all touch points, ensuring consistency and positive emotional impact.

skills.name: Conducting Usability Tests

skill_levels.skill_level_description: Cannot create user personas.

skills.name: Gathering User Feedback

skill_levels.skill_level_description: Cannot conduct user testing and feedback collection.

skill_levels.skill_level_description: Cannot write questions for user research.

limited explanation on importance of typography. thinks fonts should be readable
